reviewText: This one has 3 episodes, with the first being the classic early 80's Xmas Special, A Chipmunk Christmas.  This is the one where Alvin gives up his prize harmonica to a sick boy for Christmas, then is in a bind because Dave booked them at Carnegie Hall and now he doesn't have it to play.The other 2 episodes are from the late 80's TV show, The Chipmunks.  The first is named Merry Christmas Mr. Carroll, and I believe it is one in the same as the VHS release a while back called Alvin's Christmas Carol.  It is excatly that, Alvin is being stingy and makes up a huge Christmas list, and then is taught the meaning of Christmas by 3 ghosts.The last episode, Dave's Wonderful Life, is in the spirit of Christmas and the story of It's A Wonderful Life, however there isn't really anthing festive or Christmasy depicted.A must have for the 2 Xmas episodes, escpecially the first one, where we get the classic holiday tune, The Chipmunk Song!
summary: Alvin's finally made it to DVD with 2 Christmas episodes and one extra!

reviewText: The tiny icon on the package gave me hope that The Chipmunk Song might be the version from the '60s The Alvin Show. But no. Along with the too-cute chipmunks from the '80s revival cartoon featured in A Chipmunk Christmas are two episodes from the later DIC spin-off which, if anything, are even more sentimental and schmaltzy.A Chipmunk Christmas has an OK, warm, fuzzy holiday-themed plot that may enable many viewers to overlook the bland new chipmunks. But the DIC 'toons, while keeping the one great thing about the '80s 'toon, the great opening theme song, changes the visuals accompanying it. The opening graphics of the original perfectly underscore the Alvinish tone of the song: "It's been a while, but we're back in style." But the DIC opening goes from bland to blander.All of which makes this viewer long all the more for the '60s The Alvin Show to make it to DVD. Bits of this UPA-influenced graphically styled show were released on a VHS Alvin Sing-a-long tape through Buena Vista (Disney). Bits also appeared on Nickelodeon's excellent Wienerville Show hosted by Mark Wiener (which I also hope comes out on DVD). I join fans everywhere calling for more of Alllllviiin!

reviewText: My nephew likes the funny voice that the chipmunks talk in. He has a plush version of Alvin. My nephew loves watching this and would watch it over and over again if it didn't drive me nuts to hear chipmunk voices 24/7.I like the thoughtfulness of the golden harmonica story and selflessness shown by Alvin and believe it is a good thing to show my nephew.
summary: Just what I was looking for
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have fond memories as a kid watching A Chipmunk Christmas.  It's a shame that nobody ever puts it on TV anymore.  I was delighted when it was released on DVD a couple years ago.I don't want to give too much of the plot away but it centers an Alvin and his sick friend Tommy.  It's a funny and heartwarming special, and watching it brought back a lot of childhood Christmas memories.They also include two episodes from the later Chipmunks series.  However, I was slightly disappointed that they left off the episode where the Chipmunks' greedy Uncle Harry had Alvin, Simon, and Theodore putting on constant Christmas shows and building robot Chipmunks for a Christmas theme park.But that's a minor detail.  The main reason to purchase this is for the original special.  If you have kids, have them watch this before taking them to see the new Chipmunk movie.
Title: N/A

reviewText: We bought this DVD mainly for Kiersten(our three year old granddaughter)to watch.We were not planning on watching it till closer to Christmas but she found it and HAD to watch it.It is 66 minutes long.There are three episodes.A Chipmunk Christmas is about Alvin giving his prized harmonica to a sick little boy,but Dave has booked them to play on Christmas Eve at Carnegie Hall and now Alvin has no harmonica.If I tell anymore,it'll ruin the surprise,so just watch this one.Merry Christmas Mr.Carroll is about a VERY GREEDY Alvin who is visted by three Christmas ghosts,PAST,PRESENT and FUTURE played by Dave,Theodore and Simon.Kiersten asked why Dave(who plays Ghost of Christmas Past)looked so grouchy.Dave's Wonderful Life is not a holiday episode as it takes place in the summer on this DVD,but is OK.There are several songs done on this DVD,with The Chipmunk Song probably being the best.There were just a few things I found a bit odd on this tape.At the beginning it appeared they lived in a warm climate(a man in a swimming pool,another planting flowers,etc)but by the end of the episode they had snow.And poor Theodore,they have him riding a pink bicycle and wearing pink earmuffs.Anyhow it is still worth buying.Amazon lists it at $12.99,we bought it at Target for $9.99.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a great DVD. It really does put you in the christmas spirit as all christmas things that are witht he chipmunks do. The first episode is a christmas episode about Alivn who gives away his favorite harmonica to a very ill friend, the only problem is the harmonica was a gift to Alvin by Dave and Alvin feels that if he tells Dave, he will be mad at him. So Alivn trys to get money to buy himself another harmonica before Dave realizes what he did. In the end, Alvin gets a new harmonica, his friend gets better and Dave finds out from the friend's mother about the harmonica and isn't mad a Alvin one bit in fact he is very proud of Alvin for what he did. The Second episode is a episode where the boys get imbaressed by Dave and Dave feels that it would be better if he never existed. In a dream Dave is visted by three different angles that are Alvin, Theodore and Simon and they show him what it would be like if they had never had Dave around. The third episode is another Christmas one about Alvin wanting all the chirstmas gifts for him and doesn't care about the christmas spirit and even upsets his elderly nieghbor who lives for his morning newspaper. One Chirstmas even night Alvin is visited by three christmas angles, Theodore, Simon, and Dave who show him what the true spirit of christmas means. In the end, Alvin does nice things for his family, his elderly neighbor and goes out and buys christmas gifts for his whole family.A really great DVD that puts you in the christmas spirit.

reviewText: This DVD is quite refreshing. Not only does it have the 1980 classic A Chipmunk Christmas, but it has two Christmas episodes from the Chipmunk series, doing their versions of a Christmas Carol and It's A Wonderful Life in their own cute way. A great addition to any Christmas collection.The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is I'm a little disappointed there were no special features on this DVD. Alvin has been a great addition to Christmas ever since the release of that classic song "The Chipmunk Song" (1958). Some things on that could have been added. But I'm still glad to have Alvin and the Chipmunks as part of my Christmas.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Say "Alvin and the Chipmunks" and chances are people ranging from 6 to 60 will know who you are talking about.  The Chipmunks officially came on the scene in 1959 with their #1 Christmas hit "The Chipmunk Song" and since then have had two animated series, movie-length direct-to-DVD releases, dozens of albums, the recent motion picture, and this holiday classic from 1981."A Chipmunk Christmas" tells a heartwarming tale of Alvin who, upon hearing that an ill boy wants a harmonica for Christmas, gives him his own.  Alvin learns that doing something good often leads to difficult situations when Dave books him a concert where he is supposed to play said harmonica.  Simon and Theodore attempt to help Alvin raise the money for a new harmonica and even this gesture works up Dave's ire (as he believes Alvin only wants the money for himself, which is only partly correct).The special is brief, twenty-five minutes or so without commercials, but is packed with humor, heart, and several songs that are a delight to hear.Young audiences will enjoy it just as much as the ones who grew up watching the special when it originally aired.The DVD also comes with two Christmas-themed episodes of the second animated series.  "Dave's Wonderful Life" takes its cues from the 1946 classic of nearly the same name and "Merry Christmas, Mr. Carroll" finds Alvin learning lessons of Christmas.  In addition, you receive the soundtrack to the Christmas Special that has, until now, been out of circulation for many years.
